intro: Microstylis stenophylla var. crispatula, commonly known as the curly-leaf microstylis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves that exhibit a distinctive crinkled or curled texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
